result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew E. Hendricks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Attend, pay for and successfully complete any assessments and treatment as recommended by agent, along with 24 or 26 week domestic abuse class.

Defendant must take all medications as prescribed by his physician.

Costs are remitted by the Court.

Parties stipulate to 2 days credit in the event of revocation.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Matthew E. Hendricks in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Counsel jointly ask for 60 days as per the agent's recommendation. Court orders 60 days with huber and 4 days credit.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 30, 2017 at 11:30 am.
of Conviction (supervision extended for 6 months or until completion of domestic violence programming)

Defendant Matthew E. Hendricks in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached resolution. Colloquy. NC plea entered and accepted. Finding of guilt. 

Sentence: Sentence withheld for 12 months probation. Conditions of probation: Attend, pay for, and successfully completeany assessments and treatment as recommended by agent along with the 24 or 26 week domestic abuse class. Costs are remitted. Defendant must take all medications as prescribed by his physician. 2 days credit by stipulation.
